thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: U.S. Treasury Secretary Mnuchin says he does not expect trade war

author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S. Treasury Secretary Mnuchin says he does not expect trade war
text:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday there was a risk of a trade war between the United States and China after the countries proposed imposing tariffs on billions of dollars’ worth of one another’s goods, but that he did not expect one.
FILE PHOTO - U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin speaks during a news conference at the G20 Meeting of Finance Ministers in Buenos Aires, Argentina, March 20, 2018. REUTERS/Marcos Brindicci “Our expectation is that we don’t think there will be a trade war; our objective is to continue to have discussions with China ... I don’t expect there will be a trade war - it could be, but I don’t expect it at all,” he told CBS’ Face The Nation.
Mnuchin added that President Donald Trump and Chinese president Xi Jinping have a “very close relationship” and that the United States and China would continue to discuss trade issues.
Reporting by Michelle Price; Editing by James Dalgleish
